definition: notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees

sentences.english: I need an A in this course to get on the honor roll.
sentences.chinese: 這門功課必須要得A我才能上光榮榜。

sentences.english: Because of excellent performance at work, he is on the honor roll this year again.
sentences.chinese: 由於工作出色，他今年又上了光榮榜。

sentences.english: She's at the head of the honours list.
sentences.chinese: 她是光榮榜上的頭一名。

sentences.english: This time as usual her name appeared on the honours board.
sentences.chinese: 這一次和往常一樣，她的名字又在光榮榜上出現了。

sentences.english: I have been on a high-honor roll every semester since I was in middle school.
sentences.chinese: 從中學起，每學期我一直名列學校最高光榮榜。

sentences.english: He stands first on the honour list.
sentences.chinese: 他在光榮榜上名列第一。

sentences.english: She stands first on the honour list.
sentences.chinese: 她在光榮榜上名列第一。

sentences.english: His daughter stands first on the honour list.
sentences.chinese: 他的女兒在光榮榜上名列第一。

sentences.english: Your names will be pinned on honor roll.
sentences.chinese: 你們的名字將被列到光榮榜上。

sentences.english: Their names were all put on the honour roll.
sentences.chinese: 他們的名字都上了光榮榜。

sentences.english: And we both made our school's honour roll .
sentences.chinese: 我們倆都上了學校的光榮榜。
